description: Upper–intermediate biology course focusing on advanced cellular biology, membrane dynamics, enzyme kinetics, molecular genetics, gene expression, biotechnology, human physiology, and ecological systems. Designed to prepare students for senior-level biology and AP/IB coursework.

topics.name: Unit 1: Advanced Cell Structure & Organelles
topics.description: Detailed organelle structure and function, compartmentalization, endomembrane system, cytoskeleton components (microtubules, microfilaments, intermediate filaments), cell specialization, cell fractionation, and microscopy (electron, fluorescence, confocal)

topics.name: Unit 2: Membrane Transport & Dynamics
topics.description: Fluid mosaic model, membrane fluidity regulation, membrane proteins (channels, carriers, receptors), passive and active transport, cotransport mechanisms, bulk transport, membrane potential, electrochemical gradients, and vesicle-mediated trafficking

topics.name: Unit 3: Enzyme Kinetics & Catalysis
topics.description: Enzyme structure, catalytic mechanisms, Michaelis–Menten kinetics, Vmax and Km, competitive vs noncompetitive inhibition, cofactors, coenzymes, allosteric regulation, temperature and pH effects, and metabolic pathway coordination

topics.name: Unit 4: Cellular Communication & Signaling
topics.description: Signal transduction pathways, ligand–receptor interactions, second messengers (cAMP, Ca²⁺, IP3), G-protein coupled receptors, phosphorylation cascades, quorum sensing, endocrine/paracrine/autocrine signaling, and regulation of the cell cycle

topics.name: Unit 5: Molecular Genetics & DNA Replication
topics.description: DNA structure, semiconservative replication, replication fork dynamics, enzymes (helicase, primase, DNA polymerases, ligase), leading vs lagging strand synthesis, replication accuracy, repair mechanisms, and chromatin packaging

topics.name: Unit 6: Gene Expression – Transcription & Translation
topics.description: Central dogma, transcription initiation/elongation/termination, RNA processing, introns and exons, splicing, translation steps, ribosomes, tRNA, codons, mutations, gene regulation in prokaryotes and eukaryotes (operons, enhancers, silencers)

topics.name: Unit 7: Biotechnology & Genetic Engineering
topics.description: Recombinant DNA technology, restriction enzymes, PCR, gel electrophoresis, cloning, CRISPR–Cas9, GMOs, DNA sequencing, bioinformatics, gene therapy, and ethical issues in biotechnology

topics.name: Unit 8: Human Physiology – Major Systems
topics.description: Organ system integration, circulatory and respiratory systems, nervous and endocrine coordination, immune system mechanisms, digestive and excretory processes, muscular and skeletal system interactions, and homeostasis regulation

topics.name: Unit 9: Ecology & Ecosystem Dynamics
topics.description: Energy flow, biogeochemical cycles, population ecology, community interactions, ecological succession, ecosystem stability, biodiversity, environmental change, conservation biology, and human impact on ecosystems
